position.marginalia_text: haurire salem terra[e], et lucem Mundi.

marginalia.translation: It is pleasing to draw salt from the earth and light from the world.

position.marginalia_text: vtrunq[ue] Sapidissimum, et Splendidissimum. Alij seria pra[e]tendunt: solus Eutrapelus seria exequitur; perpetrat egregia.

marginalia.translation: Each is most prudent and most splendid. Others assert serious matters, but only Eutrapelus carries out serious matters. He accomplishes exceptional things.

position.marginalia_text: Magna in parua mutat Eutrapelus: parua in magna.

marginalia.translation: Eutrapelus changes great into small, and small into great.

position.marginalia_text: Arcana Metamorphosis Eutrapeli. Aliorum seria, in iocos conuertenda: Tui ipsius Joci, in Seria. Alienis addatur hyperbolicws, aut ironicws: Tuis detrahatur: sed pra[e]ter Tua,

marginalia.translation: The mysterious transformation of Eutrapelus. The serious matters of others must be converted into playthings. Your playthings must be converted into serious matters. One associates with strangers hyperbolically or ironically, but withhold this tendency with your friends. Apart from your own matters, everything else is nothing.
The muse is more florida than the spring.

position.marginalia_text: Malim eos Auctores, in quibus nihil deest; quàm eos, in quibus multa redundant.

marginalia.translation: I prefer those authors, in whom nothing is lacking, rather than those authors, in whom many things abound.
